properties.areaDesc: Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 11 at 5:19AM MST until February 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM EXPECTED TO BRING HEAVY SNOW OVER MOUNTAIN
AREAS...

Upper level closed low is expected to combine with a strong cold
front to bring winter weather conditions over the Gila Region and
Sacramento Mountains today through early Wednesday morning.
Temperatures will drop below freezing behind the front which will
allow the transition from rain to snow. Periods of moderate to
heavy snow are possible with this system resulting in snow
accumulations of 6 to 10(+) inches in the Sacramento Mountains,
and areas above 7500 feet in the Gila Region, with isolated higher
amounts possible. The snow should end by Wednesday morning.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to
12 inches, with locally higher amounts possible.

* WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico.

* WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday.

* TIMING... Occasional moderate to heavy snow through late early
Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute as roads
may become impassable.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and drive to
accommodate the current conditions.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY
